publisher.value: The MITRE Corporation: Standard Health Record Collaborative

display.value: Compelling evidence; indicates that assessments are based on high-quality information from multiple sources. High quality evidence does not imply that the assessment is a fact or certainty.
Suggestive evidence; indicates that assessments are based on credible and plausible information, but not of sufficient quality or corroborated sufficiently to warrant a higher level of confidence.
Weak evidence, its credibility and/or plausibility is uncertain, fragmented or poorly corroborated to make solid judgments.
